config.question: Why didn’t the Albany Plan receive adequate support from the colonial assemblies?

choices.content: The colonies did not want to defy the decision of the British Parliament.
Religious differences between the colonies posed obstacles to its acceptance.
The colonies were not ready to enter a war with the French.
The American colonies wanted to preserve their autonomy.

answer_3.response: Consider This: The Albany Plan envisioned the formation of a Grand Council, made up of elected delegates from the colonies. A President General appointed by the king would preside. See L.O. 4.5 Why did colonial Americans support Great Britain’s wars against France?
